item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 12, 2024 at 1:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. FCC opens entire 6 GHz band to low power device operations (423 points | 155 comments)
2. Mysterious New Jersey drone sightings prompt call for 'state of emergency' (155 points | 193 comments)
3. Chatbot hinted a kid should kill his parents over screen time limits: lawsuit (128 points | 185 comments)
4. QEMU with VirtIO GPU Vulkan Support (118 points | 16 comments)
5. Review of Mullvad VPN (225 points | 65 comments)
6. Instant macOS install on Proxmox including AMD patches (87 points | 21 comments)
7. PeerTube mobile app: discover videos while caring for your attention (308 points | 112 comments)
8. AI Guesses Your Accent (137 points | 153 comments)
9. A letter to open-source maintainers (55 points | 4 comments)
10. Launch HN: Azalea Robotics (YC S24) – Baggage-handling robots for airports (77 points | 53 comments)
11. OnlyFans models are using AI impersonators to keep up with their DMs (95 points | 116 comments)
12. Unix Review Magazine Interviews Larry Tesler (22 points | 1 comment)
13. Pgroll – Zero-downtime, reversible, schema changes for PostgreSQL (new website) (155 points | 31 comments)
14. 2400 phone providers may be shut down by the FCC for failing to stop robocalls (211 points | 112 comments)
15. RISC-V HiFive Premier P550 Development Boards with Ubuntu Now Available (120 points | 62 comments)
16. Dioxus 0.6 – Crossplatform apps with Rust (191 points | 79 comments)
17. The Cold Email Handbook (50 points | 15 comments)
18. The GPU is not always faster (94 points | 58 comments)
19. Borax or Baking Soda Rectifier and the glow (2003) (50 points | 5 comments)
20. Bankruptcy judge rejects sale of Infowars to The Onion (513 points | 792 comments)
21. Evolving my ergonomic setup (or, my laptop with extra steps) (101 points | 47 comments)
22. Gemini 2.0: our new AI model for the agentic era (604 points | 327 comments)
23. Charge Robotics (YC S21) is hiring MechEs to build robots that build solar farms ( | hide)
24. Trillium TPU Is GA (116 points | 53 comments)
25. The Myth of Bananaland (110 points | 73 comments)
26. Storing Times for Human Events (67 points | 33 comments)
27. Django and Postgres for the Busy Rails Developer (120 points | 62 comments)
28. Dear OAuth Providers (139 points | 33 comments)
29. WW1 dazzle camouflage was not as well understood as it might have been (6 points | 2 comments)
30. Making memcpy(NULL, NULL, 0) well-defined (193 points | 196 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 12, 2024 at 1:20 AM UTC
